intro: Elatostema griffithianum, commonly known as the Indian velvet plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Melastomataceae. It is native to parts of Asia, including India, and thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant features small, heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture, and it produces clusters of tiny, white or pale pink flowers. Elatostema griffithianum is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in dense undergrowth. Its unique morphology and adaptability make it a notable species in botanical studies.
